articles.title: Rugby-Wallabies drop Vunivalu, Kerevi to start against Argentina
articles.description: Argentina coach Michael Cheika has made four changes to his starting line-up from last week's 41-12 loss to New Zealand in Mendoza. Juan Martin Gonzalez moves from openside flanker to number eight for Rodrigo Bruni, with Santiago Grondona coming into the back row.
articles.content:
Australia coach Eddie Jones has restored Samu Kerevi to inside centre among five changes to his starting side for the Rugby Championship clash against Argentina on Saturday.

articles.description: Wallabies wield axe after South Africa smashing as NRL convert dropped in five changes

articles.title: Michael Hooper in doubt for battle with Argentina
articles.description: Wallabies co-captain Michael Hooper is likely to be ruled out of Australia’s clash against Argentina on Saturday night in Sydney.
articles.content:

articles.title: Dedollarization at Risk in Argentina As USD Zooms 5,000% Vs. Peso
articles.description: The Argentine peso's plummeting value against the US dollar is undermining the country's efforts to rely less on the greenback, fueling calls for dollarization instead.
articles.content:
The US dollar soared almost 5,000% versus Argentina's peso over the past decade, as the country faces a debt and inflation crisis.
That's fueling calls for the nation to dump the peso and adopt the greenback itself as its currency.
That could undermi... [2685 chars]

articles.title: Dollarization is the only way out for Argentina from its deepening debt trap, top economist Steve Hanke says
articles.description: The top economist's comments as the South American nation struggles with a collapsing currency, triple-digit inflation and a mountain of debt.
articles.content:
US dollar and Argentina peso pictured. Nora Mazzini
Argentina's only way out of its debt trap is by adopting the US dollar as its currency, Steve Hanke said.
"The only way out of ARG's debt trap = DOLLARIZATION," the top economist said in a tweet.

articles.title: Rugby-All Blacks captain Cane apologises for tripping pitch invader
articles.description:
New Zealand captain Sam Cane has apologised for tripping a pitch invader after their 41-12 Rugby Championship win over Argentina on Saturday.
Cane said on social media he had made an "error in judgement" by playing a part in stopping the pitch invader. "I acknowledge that this is not my role and it is out of character of me to act in such a way," he wrote.
articles.content: New Zealand captain Sam Cane has apologised for tripping a pitch invader after their 41-12 Rugby Championship win over Argentina on Saturday. Standing with team mates after the away game in Mendoza, Cane stuck out a leg as a young fan ran by the grou... [947 chars]
